030/**
031 * A limited subset of JSON-Schema's items object.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * The Items Object is a limited subset of JSON-Schema's items object. It is used by parameter definitions that are 
035 * not located in "body" to describe the type of items in an array. This is particularly useful for query parameters, 
036 * path parameters, and header parameters that accept arrays.
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
039 * <p>
040 * The Items Object supports the following fields from JSON Schema:
041 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
042 *    <li><c>type</c> (string, REQUIRED) - The data type. Values: <js>"string"</js>, <js>"number"</js>, <js>"integer"</js>, <js>"boolean"</js>, <js>"array"</js>
043 *    <li><c>format</c> (string) - The format modifier (e.g., <js>"int32"</js>, <js>"int64"</js>, <js>"float"</js>, <js>"double"</js>, <js>"date"</js>, <js>"date-time"</js>)
044 *    <li><c>items</c> ({@link Items}) - Required if type is <js>"array"</js>. Describes the type of items in the array
045 *    <li><c>collectionFormat</c> (string) - How multiple values are formatted. Values: <js>"csv"</js>, <js>"ssv"</js>, <js>"tsv"</js>, <js>"pipes"</js>, <js>"multi"</js>
046 *    <li><c>default</c> (any) - The default value
047 *    <li><c>maximum</c> (number), <c>exclusiveMaximum</c> (boolean), <c>minimum</c> (number), <c>exclusiveMinimum</c> (boolean) - Numeric constraints
048 *    <li><c>maxLength</c> (integer), <c>minLength</c> (integer), <c>pattern</c> (string) - String constraints
049 *    <li><c>maxItems</c> (integer), <c>minItems</c> (integer), <c>uniqueItems</c> (boolean) - Array constraints
050 *    <li><c>enum</c> (array) - Possible values for this item
051 *    <li><c>multipleOf</c> (number) - Must be a multiple of this value
052 * </ul>
053 *
054 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
055 * <p class='bcode'>
056 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
057 *    Items <jv>x</jv> = <jsm>items</jsm>(<js>"string"</js>).minLength(2);
058 *
059 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
060 *    String <jv>json</jv> = Json.<jsm>from</jsm>(<jv>x</jv>);
061 *
062 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
063 *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>x</jv>.toString();
064 * </p>
065 * <p class='bcode'>
066 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
067 *    {
068 *       <js>"type"</js>: <js>"string"</js>,
069 *       <js>"minLength"</js>: 2
070 *    }
071 * </p>
072 *
073 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
074 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#items-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; Items Object</a>
075 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/describing-parameters/">OpenAPI Describing Parameters</a>
076 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
077 * </ul>
078 */
079@FluentSetters
080public class Items extends OpenApiElement {
081
082   private static final String[] VALID_TYPES = {"string", "number", "integer", "boolean", "array"};
083   private static final String[] VALID_COLLECTION_FORMATS = {"csv","ssv","tsv","pipes","multi"};
084
085   private String
086      type,
087      format,
088      collectionFormat,
089      pattern,
090      ref;
091   private Number
092      maximum,
093      minimum,
094      multipleOf;
095   private Integer
096      maxLength,
097      minLength,
098      maxItems,
099      minItems;
100   private Boolean
101      exclusiveMaximum,
102      exclusiveMinimum,
103      uniqueItems;
104   private Items items;  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
105   private Object _default;  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
106   private List<Object> _enum;  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
107
108   /**
109    * Default constructor.
110    */
111   public Items() {}
112
113   /**
114    * Copy constructor.
115    *
116    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
117    */
118   public Items(Items copyFrom) {
119      super(copyFrom);
120
121      this.type = copyFrom.type;
122      this.format = copyFrom.format;
123      this.collectionFormat = copyFrom.collectionFormat;
124      this.pattern = copyFrom.pattern;
125      this.maximum = copyFrom.maximum;
126      this.minimum = copyFrom.minimum;
127      this.multipleOf = copyFrom.multipleOf;
128      this.maxLength = copyFrom.maxLength;
129      this.minLength = copyFrom.minLength;
130      this.maxItems = copyFrom.maxItems;
131      this.minItems = copyFrom.minItems;
132      this.exclusiveMaximum = copyFrom.exclusiveMaximum;
133      this.exclusiveMinimum = copyFrom.exclusiveMinimum;
134      this.uniqueItems = copyFrom.uniqueItems;
135      this.items = copyFrom.items == null ? null : copyFrom.items.copy();
136      this._default = copyFrom._default;
137      this._enum = copyOf(copyFrom._enum);
138      this.ref = copyFrom.ref;
139   }
140

142    * Make a deep copy of this object.
143    *
144    * @return A deep copy of this object.
145    */
146   public Items copy() {
147      return new Items(this);
148   }

154      return this;
155   }

163   /**

172      return type;
173   }
174
175   /**
176    * Bean property setter:  <property>type</property>.
177    *
178    * <p>
179    * The internal type of the array.
180    *
181    * @param value
182    *    The new value for this property.
183    *    <br>Valid values:
184    *    <ul>
185    *       <li><js>"string"</js>
186    *       <li><js>"number"</js>
187    *       <li><js>"integer"</js>
188    *       <li><js>"boolean"</js>
189    *       <li><js>"array"</js>
190    *    </ul>
191    *    <br>Property value is required.
192    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
193    * @return This object
194    */
195   public Items setType(String value) {
196      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_TYPES))
197         throw new IllegalArgumentException(
198            "Invalid value passed in to setType(String).  Value='"+value+"', valid values="
199            + Json5Serializer.DEFAULT.toString(VALID_TYPES));
200      type = value;
201      return this;
202   }

263    *

265    * Determines the format of the array if type array is used.
266    *
267    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.

270      return collectionFormat;
271   }
272
273   /**
274    * Bean property setter:  <property>collectionFormat</property>.
275    *
276    * <p>
277    * Determines the format of the array if type array is used.
278    *
279    * @param value
280    *    The new value for this property.
281    *    <br>Valid values:
282    *    <ul>
283    *       <li><js>"csv"</js> (default) - comma separated values <code>foo,bar</code>.
284    *       <li><js>"ssv"</js> - space separated values <code>foo bar</code>.
285    *       <li><js>"tsv"</js> - tab separated values <code>foo\tbar</code>.
286    *       <li><js>"pipes"</js> - pipe separated values <code>foo|bar</code>.
287    *    </ul>
288    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
289    * @return This object
290    */
291   public Items setCollectionFormat(String value) {
292      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_COLLECTION_FORMATS))
293         throw new BasicRuntimeException(
294            "Invalid value passed in to setCollectionFormat(String).  Value=''{0}'', valid values={1}",
295            value, VALID_COLLECTION_FORMATS
296         );
297      collectionFormat = value;
298      return this;
299   }

590   /**
591    * Adds one or more values to the <property>enum</property> property.
592    *
593    * @param values
594    *    The values to add to this property.
595    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
596    * @return This object
597    */
598   public Items addEnum(Object...values) {
599      _enum = listBuilder(_enum).elementType(Object.class).sparse().addAny(values).build();
600      return this;
601   }
602
603   /**
604    * Adds one or more values to the <property>enum</property> property.
605    *
606    * @param values
607    *    The values to add to this property.
608    *    <br>Valid types:
609    *    <ul>
610    *       <li><code>Object</code>
611    *       <li><code>Collection&lt;Object&gt;</code>
612    *       <li><code>String</code> - JSON array representation of <code>Collection&lt;Object&gt;</code>
613    *          <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
614    *          <p class='bcode'>
615    *    _enum(<js>"['foo','bar']"</js>);
616    *          </p>
617    *       <li><code>String</code> - Individual values
618    *          <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
619    *          <p class='bcode'>
620    *    _enum(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>);
621    *          </p>
622    *    </ul>
623    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
624    * @return This object
625    */
626   public Items setEnum(Object...values) {  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
627      _enum = listBuilder(_enum).elementType(Object.class).sparse().addAny(values).build();
628      return this;
629   }

673      ref = Utils.s(value);
674      return this;
675   }
676
677   // <FluentSetters>
678
679   // </FluentSetters>
680
681   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
682   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
683      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
684      return switch (property) {
685         case "type" -> toType(getType(), type);
686         case "format" -> toType(getFormat(), type);
687         case "items" -> toType(getItems(), type);
688         case "collectionFormat" -> toType(getCollectionFormat(), type);
689         case "default" -> toType(getDefault(), type);
690         case "maximum" -> toType(getMaximum(), type);
691         case "exclusiveMaximum" -> toType(getExclusiveMaximum(), type);
692         case "minimum" -> toType(getMinimum(), type);
693         case "exclusiveMinimum" -> toType(getExclusiveMinimum(), type);
694         case "maxLength" -> toType(getMaxLength(), type);
695         case "minLength" -> toType(getMinLength(), type);
696         case "pattern" -> toType(getPattern(), type);
697         case "maxItems" -> toType(getMaxItems(), type);
698         case "minItems" -> toType(getMinItems(), type);
699         case "uniqueItems" -> toType(getUniqueItems(), type);
700         case "enum" -> toType(getEnum(), type);
701         case "multipleOf" -> toType(getMultipleOf(), type);
702         case "$ref" -> toType(getRef(), type);
703         default -> super.get(property, type);
704      };
705   }
706
707   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
708   public Items set(String property, Object value) {
709      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
710      return switch (property) {
711         case "$ref" -> setRef(value);
712         case "collectionFormat" -> setCollectionFormat(Utils.s(value));
713         case "default" -> setDefault(value);
714         case "enum" -> setEnum(value);
715         case "exclusiveMaximum" -> setExclusiveMaximum(toBoolean(value));
716         case "exclusiveMinimum" -> setExclusiveMinimum(toBoolean(value));
717         case "format" -> setFormat(Utils.s(value));
718         case "items" -> setItems(toType(value, Items.class));
719         case "maxItems" -> setMaxItems(toInteger(value));
720         case "maxLength" -> setMaxLength(toInteger(value));
721         case "maximum" -> setMaximum(toNumber(value));
722         case "minItems" -> setMinItems(toInteger(value));
723         case "minLength" -> setMinLength(toInteger(value));
724         case "minimum" -> setMinimum(toNumber(value));
725         case "multipleOf" -> setMultipleOf(toNumber(value));
726         case "pattern" -> setPattern(Utils.s(value));
727         case "type" -> setType(Utils.s(value));
728         case "uniqueItems" -> setUniqueItems(toBoolean(value));
729         default -> {
730            super.set(property, value);
731            yield this;
732         }
733      };
734   }
735
736   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
737   public Set<String> keySet() {
738      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
739         .addIf(ref != null, "$ref")
740         .addIf(collectionFormat != null, "collectionFormat")
741         .addIf(_default != null, "default")
742         .addIf(_enum != null, "enum")
743         .addIf(exclusiveMaximum != null, "exclusiveMaximum")
744         .addIf(exclusiveMinimum != null, "exclusiveMinimum")
745         .addIf(format != null, "format")
746         .addIf(items != null, "items")
747         .addIf(maxItems != null, "maxItems")
748         .addIf(maxLength != null, "maxLength")
749         .addIf(maximum != null, "maximum")
750         .addIf(minItems != null, "minItems")
751         .addIf(minLength != null, "minLength")
752         .addIf(minimum != null, "minimum")
753         .addIf(multipleOf != null, "multipleOf")
754         .addIf(pattern != null, "pattern")
755         .addIf(type != null, "type")
756         .addIf(uniqueItems != null, "uniqueItems")
757         .build();
758      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
759   }
760
761   /**
762    * Resolves any <js>"$ref"</js> attributes in this element.
763    *
764    * @param openApi The swagger document containing the definitions.
765    * @param refStack Keeps track of previously-visited references so that we don't cause recursive loops.
766    * @param maxDepth
767    *    The maximum depth to resolve references.
768    *    <br>After that level is reached, <code>$ref</code> references will be left alone.
769    *    <br>Useful if you have very complex models and you don't want your swagger page to be overly-complex.
770    * @return
771    *    This object with references resolved.
772    *    <br>May or may not be the same object.
773    */
774   public Items resolveRefs(OpenApi openApi, Deque<String> refStack, int maxDepth) {
775
776      if (ref != null) {
777         if (refStack.contains(ref) || refStack.size() >= maxDepth)
778            return this;
779         refStack.addLast(ref);
780         var r = openApi.findRef(ref, Items.class);
781         r = r.resolveRefs(openApi, refStack, maxDepth);
782         refStack.removeLast();
783         return r;
784      }
785
786      set("properties", resolveRefs(get("properties"), openApi, refStack, maxDepth));
787
788      if (items != null)
789         items = items.resolveRefs(openApi, refStack, maxDepth);
790
791      set("example", null);
792
793      return this;
794   }
795
796   /* Resolve references in extra attributes */
797   private Object resolveRefs(Object o, OpenApi openApi, Deque<String> refStack, int maxDepth) {
798      if (o instanceof JsonMap om) {
799         var ref2 = om.get("$ref");
800         if (ref2 instanceof CharSequence) {
801            var sref = ref2.toString();
802            if (refStack.contains(sref) || refStack.size() >= maxDepth)
803               return o;
804            refStack.addLast(sref);
805            var o2 = openApi.findRef(sref, Object.class);
806            o2 = resolveRefs(o2, openApi, refStack, maxDepth);
807            refStack.removeLast();
808            return o2;
809         }
810         for (var e : om.entrySet())
811            e.setValue(resolveRefs(e.getValue(), openApi, refStack, maxDepth));
812      }
813      if (o instanceof JsonList x)
814         for (var li = x.listIterator(); li.hasNext();)
815            li.set(resolveRefs(li.next(), openApi, refStack, maxDepth));
816      return o;
817   }
818}
